Package uk.ac.ebi.utils.collections

Interface OptionsMap

All Superinterfaces:
Map<String,Object>
All Known Implementing Classes:
OptionsMapWrapper
public interface OptionsMap extends Map<String,Object>
A variant of the map interface that has the purpose of easing the manipulation of options based on string values. These are typically fetched from Properties and the like. See unit tests for details.
Author:
brandizi
Date:
16 Sep 2020

  • Method Details

    • getOpt

      default <V> V getOpt(String key, V defaultValue, Function<String,V> converter)
      Convert a string value returned by the key using the converter parameter. If the key is null, returns the default If it's a string, returns the result of the conversion Else, casts it to V, possibly raising ClassCastException The idea is that we're dealing with a mix of object values or string values that might represent some other types. This is a base for other specific methods (eg, getDouble(String, Double). *

    • getOpt

      default <V> V getOpt(String key, Function<String,V> converter)
      Default is null

    • getOpt

      default <V> V getOpt(String key, V defaultValue)
      No conversion, returned value type depends on what it was stored

    • getOpt

      default <V> V getOpt(String key)
      null as default value and no conversion

    • getString

      default String getString(String key, String defaultValue)
      Expects the key to return a string and returns it as-is. In other words, this is just to make the type casting easier.

    • unmodifiableOptionsMap

      static OptionsMap unmodifiableOptionsMap(Map<String,Object> base)
      This is simply the chaining of from(Map) and Collections.unmodifiableMap(Map), ie, returns a read-only options map.
